ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Uses formatting characters to add line-drawing characters to the report.

[Syntax: BYPAGENO=number] 
      
If a BY statement is present, specifies the listing page number at the start of each BY group. 

Range: any positive integer greater than 0. 
Restriction: This option has no effect if a BY statement is not present.
Specifies to center or left-justify the report and summary text (customized break lines).
Specifies to left-justify the report and summary text (customized break lines).

[Syntax: COLWIDTH=column-width] 
      
Specifies the default number of characters for columns containing computed variables 
or numeric data set variables.
Displays command lines rather than menu bars in all REPORT windows.

Displays all possible combinations of the values of the group variables, 
even if one or more of the combinations do not occur in the input data set.
Specifies not to display all possible combinations of the values of the group variables.

Creates all possible combinations for the values of the across variables even if one or more
of the combinations do not occur within the input data set.
Specifies not to create all possible combinations for the values of the across variables.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='link-text'] 
      
Specifies the text for the entries in the HTML contents file or PDF table of contents 
for the output that is produced by PROC REPORT.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the input data set.
Excludes observations with nonpositive weight values (zero or negative) from the analysis.

[Syntax: FORMCHAR <(position(s))>='formatting-character(s)'] 
      
Defines the characters to use as line-drawing characters in the report.

Underlines all column headings and the spaces between them at the top of each page 
of the report.

Writes a blank line beneath all column headings (or beneath the underlining that the HEADLINE 
option writes) at the top of each page of the report.

[Syntax: HELP=libref.catalog] 
      
Identifies the library and catalog containing user-defined help for the report. This help can be in 
CBT or HELP catalog entries.
Writes to the SAS log the PROC REPORT code that creates the current report.

[Syntax: LS=line-size] 
      
Specifies the length of a line of the report.
Considers missing values as valid values for group, order, or across variables.
Writes name= in front of each value in the report, where name is the column heading for the value.

Lets you use a report that was created before compute blocks required aliases (before 
Release 6.11). If you use NOALIAS, then you cannot use aliases in compute blocks.

Suppresses the building of the report. Use NOEXEC with OUTREPT= to store a report definition 
in a catalog entry. Use NOEXEC with LIST and REPORT= to display a listing of the specified 
report definition.
Suppresses column headings, including headings that span multiple columns.

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
      
Names the output data set. If this data set does not exist, then PROC REPORT creates it.

[Syntax: OUTREPT=libref.catalog.entry] 
      
Stores in the specified catalog entry the REPORT definition that is defined by the PROC REPORT step 
that you submit. PROC REPORT assigns the entry a type of REPT.

[Syntax: PANELS=number-of-panels] 
      
Specifies the number of panels on each page of the report.

Specifies the mathematical definition that the procedure uses to calculate quantiles when 
QMETHOD=OS. To use QMETHOD=P2, you must use QNTLDEF=5.

[Syntax: PROFILE=libref.catalog] 
      
Identifies the report profile to use. A profile
Opens the REPORT window and starts the PROMPT facility.

[Syntax: PS=page-size] 
      
Specifies the number of lines in a page of the report.

[Syntax: PSPACE=space-between-panels] 
      
Specifies the number of blank characters between panels.

[Syntax: QMARKERS=number] 
      
Specifies the default number of markers to use for the P2 estimation method.
Specifies the method that PROC REPORT uses to process the input data when it computes quantiles.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Uses order statistics. This method is the same method that PROC UNIVARIATE uses.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Uses the P² method to approximate the quantile.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: REPORT=libref.catalog.entry] 
      
Specifies the report definition to use. PROC REPORT stores all report definitions as 
entries of type REPT in a SAS catalog.
Overrides options in the DEFINE statement that suppress the display of a column.

[Syntax: SPACING=space-between-columns] 
      
Specifies the number of blank characters between columns. Default is 2.

Specifies that when the value of a GROUP or ORDER column is the same in multiple rows, the 
value will be displayed in a single cell that occupies that column in all the rows for which 
the value is the same.

[Syntax: SPLIT='character'] 
      
Specifies the split character.

Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]> 
      
Specifies the style element to use for the specified locations in the report.

Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]> 
      
Specifies the style element to use for the specified locations in the report.
Enables parallel processing of the input data set.
Disables parallel processing of the input data set.
Specifies the divisor to use in the calculation of the variance and standard deviation.
Selects an interactive report window environment.
Selects an interactive report nonwindowing environment.

Displays one value from each column of the report, on consecutive lines if necessary, 
before displaying another value from the first column.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BREAK location break-variable </ option(s)>;
      
Produces a default summary at a break (a change in the value of a group or order variable).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Places the break lines immediately after the last row of each set of rows that have the 
same value for the break variable.

Places the break lines immediately before the first row of each set of rows that have the same 
value for the break variable.
Specifies the color of the break lines in the REPORT window.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='link-text'] 
          
Specifies the text for the entries in the HTML contents file or PDF table of contents 
for the output that is produced by PROC REPORT.

[For double overlining] 
          
Uses the 13th formatting character to overline each value 

      o that appears in the summary line 
      o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.

[For overlining] 
          
Uses the 13th formatting character to overline each value 

      o that appears in the summary line 
      o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.

[For double underlining] 
          
Uses the 13th formatting character to underline each value 

      o that appears in the summary line 
      o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.

[For underlining] 
          
Uses the 13th formatting character to underline each value 

      o that appears in the summary line 
      o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.

In monospace output, starts a new page. In HTML and PRINTER destinations, the PAGE option 
starts a new table.
          
Restriction In the OUTPUT destination, this option has no effect. 

Interaction: If you use PAGE in the BREAK statement and you create a break at the end of the report, 
then the summary for the whole report appears on a separate page.
Writes a blank line for the last break line.

Syntax: STYLE<location(s)>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for default summary lines that are created with the 
BREAK statement.

Syntax: STYLE<location(s)>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for default summary lines that are created with the 
BREAK statement.
Writes a summary line in each group of break lines.

Suppresses printing of 

  o the value of the break variable in the summary line

  o any underlining and overlining in the break lines in the column that contains the 
    break variable.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>; 
      
Creates a separate report on a separate page for each BY group.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CALL DEFINE (column-id | _ROW_ , 'attribute-name', value);
      
Sets the value of an attribute for a particular column in the current row.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Is an automatic variable that indicates the entire current row.

[Attribute Name] 
          
Controls the color of the current value in the REPORT window.
            
Values: 1 turns blinking on; 0 turns it off

[Attribute Name] 
          
Controls the color of the current value in the REPORT window.
          
Values: 1 'blue', 'red', 'pink', 'green', 'cyan', 'yellow', 'white', 'orange', 'black', 
'magenta', 'gray', 'brown'

[Attribute Name] 
          
Specifies that a series of commands follows.
          
Value: a quoted string of SAS commands to submit to the command line.

[Attribute Name] 
          
Specifies a format for the column.
          
Value: a SAS format or a user-defined format.

[Attribute Name] 
          
Controls highlighting of the current value.
          
Values: 1 turns highlighting on; 0 turns it off.

[Attribute Name] 
          
Controls display of the current value.
          
Values: 1 turns reverse video on; 0 turns it off.

[Attribute Name] 
          
Makes the contents of each cell of the column a link to the specified Uniform 
Resource Locator (URL).
          
Value: a quoted URL (either single or double quotation marks can be used).

[Attribute Name] 
          
Makes the contents of each cell of the column a link.
          
Value: a quoted URL (either single or double quotation marks can be used).)

[Attribute Name] 
          
Makes the contents of each cell of the column a link..
          
Value: a quoted URL (either single or double quotation marks can be used).)

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: COLUMN column-specification(s); 
      
Describes the arrangement of all columns and of headings that span more than one column.

Syntax: LINE specification(s); 
      
Provides a subset of the features of the PUT statement for writing customized summaries.

Syntax: FREQ variable; 
      
Treats observations as if they appear multiple times in the input data set.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[location] 
          
Executes the compute block at a break in one of the following places: 

  o immediately after the last row of a set of rows that have the same value for the variable 
    that you specify as target.

  o except in Printer and RTF output, near the bottom of each page, immediately before any 
    footnotes, if you specify _PAGE_ as target.

  o at the end of the report if you omit a target.

[location] 
          
Executes the compute block at a break in one of the following places: 

  o immediately before the first row of a set of rows that have the same value for the 
    variable that you specify as target.

  o except in Printer and RTF output, near the top of each page, between any titles and the 
    column headings, if you specify _PAGE_ as target.

  o immediately before the first detail row if you omit a target.

Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style to use for the text that is created by any LINE statements 
in this compute block.

Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style to use for the text that is created by any LINE statements 
in this compute block.

[Syntax: _PAGE_ </ justification>] 
          
In monospace output destinations, causes the compute block to execute once for each page, 
either immediately after printing any titles or immediately before printing any footnotes. 

justification controls the placement of text and values. It can be one of the following:

  CENTER centers each line that the compute block writes.
 
  LEFT left-justifies each line that the compute block writes.
 
  RIGHT right-justifies each line that the compute block writes.

[type-specification][Syntax: CHARACTER <LENGTH=length>] 
          
Specifies that the computed variable is a character variable. If you do not specify 
a length, then the variable's length is 8.

LENGTH=
specifies the length of a computed character variable. Default: 8. Range: 1 to 200.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DEFINE report-item / <option(s)>;
      
Describes how to use and display a report item.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Defines report-item, which must be a data set variable, as an across variable.
Defines report-item, which must be a data set variable, as an analysis variable.

Centers the formatted values of the report item within the column width and centers the column 
heading over the values.

Specifies the color in the REPORT window of the column heading and of the values of the item that 
you are defining.
Defines the specified item as a computed variable.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='link-text'] 
          
Specifies the text for the entries in the HTML contents file or PDF table of contents 
for the output that is produced by PROC REPORT.

Reverses the order in which PROC REPORT displays rows or values of a group, order, 
or across variable.
Defines report-item, which must be a data set variable, as a display variable.

Excludes from the report and the output data set all combinations of the group variables and the 
across variables that are not found in the preloaded range of user-defined formats.
Wraps the value of a character variable in its column.

[Syntax: FORMAT=format] 
          
Assigns a SAS or user-defined format to the item.
Defines report-item, which must be a data set variable, as a group variable.
Specifies that the item that you are defining is an ID variable.

[Syntax: ITEMHELP=entry-name] 
          
References a HELP or CBT entry that contains help information for the report item.

Left-justifies the formatted values of the report item within the column width and left-justifies 
the column headings over the values.
Considers missing values as valid values for the report item.

Enables PROC REPORT to use the format label or labels for a given range or for 
overlapping ranges to create subgroup combinations that use multilabel 
formatting. These multilabel formats are used only with group and across 
variables.

MLF is supported on all ODS destinations, the LISTING destination, 
data sets, and the REPORT WINDOW. 

Note: PROC REPORT supports assigning a numeric variable that has a 
multilabel format to a character variable. 

Requirement:Use PROC FORMAT and the MULTILABEL option in the VALUE 
statement to create a multilabel format. 

Tips:The MLF option has no effect unless the variable is associated 
with a multilabel format. If the column does not have a MULTILABEL 
format associated with it, then an additional FORMAT statement or 
FORMAT= option in the DEFINE statement is needed to associate an 
existing format or informat with one or more variables. If the 
column already has a MULTILABEL format associated with it (using 
any regular method to associate a format with the variable) then 
no additional FORMAT statement or FORMAT= option is needed. 

If the MLF option is omitted, PROC REPORT uses the primary format 
labels to determine the subgroup combinations. The primary format 
labels correspond to the first external format value.
Suppresses the display of the report item.
Suppresses the display of the report item if its values are all zero or missing.
Defines report-item, which must be a data set variable, as an order variable.
Orders the values of a group, order, or across variable according to the specified order.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Orders values by their formatted (external) values. If no format has been assigned  to a class variable, then the default format, BEST12., is used.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Orders values by ascending frequency count.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order  is operating environment-dependent. This sort sequence is particularly useful for  displaying dates chronologically.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Inserts a page break just before printing the first column containing values of the report item.
Specifies that the format is preloaded for the variable.

Right-justifies the formatted values of the specified item within the column width and right-justifies 
the column headings over the values.

[Syntax: SPACING=horizontal-positions] 
          
Defines the number of blank characters to leave between the column being defined 
and the column immediately to its left.
          
Default: 2 

Restriction: This option has no effect on ODS destinations other than traditional 
SAS monospace output.

[Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for column headings and for text inside cells for 
this report item.

[Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for column headings and for text inside cells for 
this report item.

[Syntax: WEIGHT=weight-variable] 
          
Specifies a numeric variable whose values weight the values of the analysis variable 
that is specified in the DEFINE statement.

[Syntax: WIDTH=column-width] 
          
Defines the width of the column in which PROC REPORT displays report-item.
Sum of squares corrected for the mean
Percent coefficient of variation
Maximum value
Arithmetic mean
Minimum value
Most frequent value
Number of observations that are not missing
Number of observations that are missing
Range calculated as the difference between maximum value and minimum value.
Standard deviation
Standard error of the mean
Sum
Sum of the weights
Uncorrected sum of squares
Variance
Middle value
1st percentile
5th percentile
10th percentile
20th percentile
Lower quartile (25th percentile)
Lower quartile (30th percentile)
40th percentile
60th percentile
70th percentile
Upper quartile (75th percentile)
80th percentile
90th percentile
95th percentile
99th percentile
Interquartile range and is calculated as Q3-Q1
Two-tailed p-value for Student's t statistic
Student's t statistic
Places the break lines at the end of the report.
Places the break lines at the beginning of the report.
Specifies the color of the break lines in the REPORT window.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='link-text'] 
          
Specifies the text for the entries in the HTML contents file or PDF 
table of contents for the output that is produced by PROC REPORT.

[For double overlining] 
          
Uses the 13th formatting character to overline each value 

  o that appears in the summary line 
  o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.

[For double underlining] 
          
Uses the 13th formatting character to underline each value 

  o that appears in the summary line 
  o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.

[For overlining] 
          
Uses the second formatting character to overline each value 

  o that appears in the summary line 
  o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.
Starts a new page after the last break line of a break located at the beginning of the report.

Writes a blank line after the last break line of a break located at the beginning of the report.

Restriction: This option has no effect on ODS destinations other than traditional 
SAS monospace output.

Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for default summary lines that are created with the 
RBREAK statement.

Syntax: STYLE<(location(s))>=<style-element-name><[style-attribute-specification(s)]>
          
Specifies the style element to use for default summary lines that are created with the 
RBREAK statement.
Includes a summary line as one of the break lines.

(For underlining) uses the second formatting character to underline each value 

  o that appears in the summary line 
  o that would appear in the summary line if you specified the SUMMARIZE option.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: WEIGHT variable;
      
Specifies weights for analysis variables in the statistical calculations.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
If the conditions that are specified in the IF clause are met, the IF-THEN statement executes 
a SAS statement for observations that are read from a SAS data set, for records in an external 
file, or for computed values.
Action statement in an IF-THEN construct.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
If the condition in a IF-THEN statement is false and an ELSE statement is present, then the ELSE 
action is carried out.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
If the conditions that are specified in the IF clause are met, the IF-THEN statement executes 
a SAS statement for observations that are read from a SAS data set, for records in an external 
file, or for computed values.
Executes a SAS statement for observations that meet specific conditions.
Action statement in an ELSE statement.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: LENGTH variable-specification(s)<DEFAULT=n>; 
      
Specifies the number of bytes for storing variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DEFAULT=n] 
          
Changes the default number of bytes that SAS uses to store the values of any newly created 
numeric variables.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: END; 
      
Ends a DO group or SELECT group processing.
